intro: Wittmackia odora, commonly known as the fragrant bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Wittmackia odora thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Its fragrant blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens.
